detaileddescription.para:
This scope is injected into the expression context used for rendering the map, and can be used to apply specific variable overrides for expression evaluation for the map canvas render.

QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Returns a const reference to the expression context scope for the map canvas.
Returns the current zoom extent of the map canvas.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsVectorLayer *layer, const QgsFeatureIds &ids, const QColor &startColor=QColor(255, 0, 0, 255), const QColor &endColor=QColor(255, 0, 0, 0), int flashes=3, int duration=500)
memberdef.name: flashFeatureIds

briefdescription.para: Causes a set of features with matching ids from a vector layer to flash within the canvas.

detaileddescription.para: The startColor and endColor can be specified, along with the number of flashes and duration of each flash (in milliseconds).

simplesect.para: If the features or geometries are already available, flashGeometries() is much more efficient.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QList< QgsGeometry > &geometries, const QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem &crs=QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem(), const QColor &startColor=QColor(255, 0, 0, 255), const QColor &endColor=QColor(255, 0, 0, 0), int flashes=3, int duration=500)
memberdef.name: flashGeometries

briefdescription.para: Causes a set of geometries to flash within the canvas.

detaileddescription.para: If crs is a valid coordinate reference system, the geometries will be automatically transformed from this CRS to the canvas CRS.
The startColor and endColor can be specified, along with the number of flashes and duration of each flash (in milliseconds).

briefdescription.para: Freeze/thaw the map canvas.

detaileddescription.para:
This is used to prevent the canvas from responding to events while layers are being added/removed etc.
frozen
Boolean specifying if the canvas should be frozen (true) or thawed (false). Default is true.
isFrozen()
setRenderFlag(). freeze() should be used to programmatically halt map updates, while setRenderFlag() should only be used when users disable rendering via GUI.

briefdescription.para: Returns the combined extent for all layers on the map canvas.
Gets the current coordinate transform.
Check whether images of rendered layers are curerently being cached.
Find out whether rendering is in progress.
Returns true if canvas is frozen.

simplesect.para: renderFlag(). isFrozen() should be used to determine whether map updates have been halted programmatically, while renderFlag() should be used to determine whether a user has disabled rendering via GUI.

briefdescription.para: Check whether the layers are rendered in parallel or sequentially.

Returns the stored overrides of styles for layers.
Returns the magnification factor.

detaileddescription.para: The map units are dictated by the canvas' destinationCrs() map units.

briefdescription.para: Returns the mapUnitsPerPixel (map units per pixel) for the canvas.

Called when mouse is moving and pan is activated.

Pan to the selected features of current (vector) layer keeping same extent.

Returns true if canvas map preview jobs (low priority render jobs which render portions of the view just outside of the canvas extent, to allow preview of these out-of-canvas areas when panning or zooming out the map) are enabled for the canvas.
Returns the current preview mode for the map canvas.

detaileddescription.para:
This setting only has an effect if previewModeEnabled is true.
preview mode for map canvas

QGIS 2.3

briefdescription.para: Returns whether a preview mode is enabled for the map canvas.

simplesect.para: true if a preview mode is currently enabled

briefdescription.para: Returns true if canvas render is disabled as a result of user disabling renders via the GUI.

simplesect.para: isFrozen(). isFrozen() should be used to determine whether map updates have been halted programmatically, while renderFlag() should be used to determine whether a user has disabled rendering via GUI.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current map canvas rotation in clockwise degrees.
Returns the last reported scale of the canvas.

detaileddescription.para: The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.

detaileddescription.para:
This scope is injected into the expression context used for rendering the map, and can be used to apply specific variable overrides for expression evaluation for the map canvas render. This method will overwrite the existing expression context scope for the canvas.
scope
new expression context scope
expressionContextScope()
defaultExpressionContextScope()
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Sets the extent of the map canvas.
Sets global labeling engine settings in the internal map settings.
Sets the list of layers that should be shown in the canvas.

detaileddescription.para: If the map canvas has been associated with a map theme via a call to setTheme(), then any calls to setLayers() are ignored. It is necessary to first clear the theme association by calling setTheme() with an empty string before setLayers() calls can be made.

briefdescription.para: Sets the stored overrides of styles for rendering layers.

detaileddescription.para: If the map canvas has been associated with a map theme via a call to setTheme(), then any calls to setLayerStyleOverrides() are ignored. It is necessary to first clear the theme association by calling setTheme() with an empty string before setLayerStyleOverrides() calls can be made.

briefdescription.para: Resets the flags for the canvas' map settings.
Sets the map tool currently being used on the canvas.
Set how often map preview should be updated while it is being rendered (in milliseconds)
Set whether the layers are rendered in parallel or sequentially.

Sets whether canvas map preview jobs (low priority render jobs which render portions of the view just outside of the canvas extent, to allow preview of these out-of-canvas areas when panning or zooming out the map) are enabled for the canvas.
Sets a preview mode for the map canvas.

detaileddescription.para:
This setting only has an effect if previewModeEnabled is true.
mode
preview mode for the canvas
previewMode
setPreviewModeEnabled
previewModeEnabled
QGIS 2.3

briefdescription.para: Enables a preview mode for the map canvas.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to enable a preview mode

briefdescription.para: Set the rotation of the map canvas in clockwise degrees.
Sets the segmentation tolerance applied when rendering curved geometries.
Sets segmentation tolerance type (maximum angle or maximum difference between curve and approximation)
Set color of selected vector features.
Assign an instance of snapping utils to the map canvas.

detaileddescription.para: The instance is not owned by the canvas, so it is possible to use one instance in multiple canvases.

For main canvas in QGIS, do not associate a different instance from the existing one (it is updated from the project's snapping configuration).
QGIS 2.8

briefdescription.para: Sets a map theme to show in the canvas.

detaileddescription.para: The theme name must match a theme present in the associated project's QgsMapThemeCollection.

When the canvas is associated to a map theme, it will automatically follow the layer selection and layer styles from that theme. Calls to setLayers() or setLayerStyleOverrides() will have no effect, and canvases associated with a QgsLayerTreeMapCanvasBridge will no longer synchronize their state with the layer tree. In these cases it is necessary to call setTheme() with an empty string to clear the theme association and allow map updates with setLayers(), setLayerStyleOverrides(), or via QgsLayerTreeMapCanvasBridge.

If an empty string is passed then the current theme association will be cleared.
theme()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets wheel zoom factor (should be greater than 1)
Returns snapping utility class that is associated with map canvas.

detaileddescription.para: If no snapping utils instance has been associated previously, an internal will be created for convenience (so map tools do not need to test for existence of the instance).

Main canvas in QGIS returns an instance which is always up-to-date with the project's snapping configuration.
QGIS 2.8

briefdescription.para: Returns the map's theme shown in the canvas, if set.
Unset the current map tool or last non zoom tool.

detaileddescription.para: This is called from destructor of map tools to make sure that this map tool won't be used any more. You don't have to call it manually, QgsMapTool takes care of it.

briefdescription.para: Emits signal scaleChanged to update scale in main window.
Blocks until the rendering job has finished.

detaileddescription.para: In almost all cases you do NOT want to call this, as it will hang the UI until the rendering job is complete. It's included in API solely for unit testing and standalone Python scripts.

briefdescription.para: Zoom with the factor supplied.

detaileddescription.para: Factor > 1 zooms out, interval (0,1) zooms in If point is given, re-center on it

briefdescription.para: Zooms the canvas to a specific scale.

detaileddescription.para: The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.

briefdescription.para: Zooms to feature extent.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a small margin around the extent and does a pan if rect is empty (point extent)

briefdescription.para: Set canvas extent to the bounding box of a set of features.
Zoom to the full extent of all layers.
Zoom to the next extent (view)
Zoom to the previous extent (view)
Zooms in/out with a given center.
This slot is connected to the visibility change of one or more layers.
called to read map canvas settings from project
Repaints the canvas map.
Reload all layers, clear the cache and refresh the canvas.
Save the convtents of the map canvas to disk as an image.
Receives signal about selection change, and pass it on with layer info.
Sets the factor of magnification to apply to the map canvas.

detaileddescription.para:
Indeed, we increase/decrease the DPI of the map settings according to this factor in order to render marker point, labels, ... bigger.

Emitted when the canvas has rendered.

detaileddescription.para:
Passes a pointer to the painter on which the map was drawn. This is useful for plugins that wish to draw on the map after it has been rendered. Passing the painter allows plugins to work when the map is being rendered onto a pixmap other than the mapCanvas own pixmap member. TODO: deprecate when decorations are reimplemented as map canvas items
anything related to rendering progress is not visible outside of map canvas
additional drawing shall be done directly within the renderer job or independently as a map canvas item

briefdescription.para: Emitted when the canvas is about to be rendered.

Emitted when the scale of the map changes.
Emitted when selection in any layer gets changed.
Emitted when the canvas has been assigned a different map theme.
Emitted when the canvas transform context is changed.
Emits current mouse position.

Map canvas is a class for displaying all GIS data types on a canvas.
